intro: Webera corymbosa, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine layer of white pubescence. The flowers bloom in corymbs, which are flat-topped clusters, and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
